translation.en: [narrator] Traditions are a form of magic.
Because traditions
are a way of talking to the past.
Of speaking to our ancestors
in a language that they created.
When you participate in a tradition,
you are casting a spell
that lets you talk directly to a bygone era.
translation.ko: 직접 대화할 수 있는 마법의 주문을 건다

translation.en: Nowhere is this enchanted connection stronger
translation.ko: 이 마법의 연결 고리가 영국의 농경지보다

translation.en: than in the farmlands of England.
And in this bastion of agriculture,
there is no tradition more powerful...
than cheese...
rolling.
[woman] It's a heavy cheese
coming at 80 miles an hour.
There's a chance it could knock the fence.
You are all stood there at your own risk.
[whistles] All medical staff need to go behind that fence.
translation.ko: 의료진은 모두 저쪽 울타리 뒤로 가세요

translation.en: What I am saying to all adults with children,
if the cheese does come over here,
protect those kids.
[narrator] For centuries,
deep in the English countryside,
the good people of Brockworth have gathered
to watch an ancient ceremony.
A race down a hill,
chasing a wheel
of Double Gloucester cheese.
The race is over 100 meters long.
The hill is steeper than 45 degrees.
This is no ordinary race.
It is the most dangerous foot race in the world.
And this is no ordinary hill.
This... is Cooper's Hill.
[announcer] One to be ready,
two to be steady,
three for cheese, four to go!
[narrator] Every year,
the cheese roll attracts a certain type of athlete.
translation.ko: 치즈 롤은 특정 유형의 참가자를 끌어들인다

translation.en: [woman] We get called crazy.
We get called unique.
Which is great, fantastic.
I think the villagers love it.
And it's traditional. It's very old.
And not many things in this world
translation.ko: 요즘 세상에 지역 사회가 뭔가를 오랫동안

translation.en: is kept by communities that is very old.
translation.ko: 요즘 세상에 지역 사회가 뭔가를 오랫동안 유지하는 경우가 흔치 않아요

translation.en: [narrator] The competitors are not trying to catch the cheese,
which, since it thunders down the hill at over 80 miles per hour...
translation.ko: 치즈의 속도가 시속 130km를 넘는 걸 감안하면

translation.en: ...is probably smart.
Instead, the winner is the first person over the line at the bottom of the hill.
translation.ko: 언덕 아래 결승선에 가장 먼저 도착하는 우승자다

translation.en: They are crowned the "Champion Cheese-Chaser"
and given the glory
of holding the eight-pound cheese aloft
in the signature winner's pose.
It's so wacky, so unique.
translation.ko: 너무 엉뚱하고 독특하니까 사람들이 해 보고 싶어 해요

translation.en: People just want to have a go. They just want to say they've done it.
translation.ko: 너무 엉뚱하고 독특하니까 사람들이 해 보고 싶어 해요 자기도 해 봤단 말을 하려고요

translation.en: [interviewer] Why do you take part?
'Cause I'm mad. That's why.
[narrator] But the race is not without controversy.
translation.ko: 이 경주에 논란이 없는 건 아니다

translation.en: A constant parade of injuries has transformed this ancient tradition
translation.ko: 끝없는 부상 행렬로 인해 이 고대 전통은

translation.en: into a completely unsanctioned event.
[Sara] People say it's unofficial. It's not.
It's official.
Because it definitely goes on every year exactly how it did ten,
fifteen years ago.
Unfortunately, with this event, there is no organizer that's forthcoming,
translation.ko: 이 행사 주최자라고 나서는 사람이 없기 때문에

translation.en: as such, it is very difficult to put those safety precautions in place.
You can cancel it officially, but it will always go on like this.
translation.ko: 공식적으로 취소돼도 늘 이렇게 진행될 거예요

translation.en: As a vegan, I wouldn't put my life at risk
to chase a cheese.
[Sara] I'm not saying everybody's positive for it.
However, it doesn't matter. They won't make it stop.
[Sara] It's not because we're rebels. We were called rebels.
translation.ko: 반역하는 것도 아닌데 반역자로 불린 적은 있어요

translation.en: But isn't that nice to be a bit of a rebel, but a nice rebel?
translation.ko: 근데 좋은 반역자라면 그것도 괜찮지 않아요?

translation.en: I'll take "rebel."
[narrator] Roll on, you beautiful rebels.
And give it your all... for the cheese.
For the cheese!
[narrator] The common cheese-chaser takes many forms.
But the champion cheese-chaser,
like the Double Gloucester she pursues,
translation.ko: 더블 글로스터를 뒤쫓는 챔피언 치즈 추격자는

translation.en: is local...
complex...
and not fully mature.
I'm Florence Early, and I'm a three-times cheese-rolling champ.
translation.ko: 플로렌스 얼리예요 치즈 롤링에서 세 번 우승했죠

translation.en: [Florence] When you have a landscape like this, it's like a playground.
We save it all for the kids, and it's such a shame.
translation.ko: 아이들을 위해 아껴 둔 건데 정말 안타까워요

translation.en: We unlearn how to have fun.
The hill is just another-- another landscape to tackle.
translation.ko: 언덕은 정복할 또 다른 경치일 뿐이죠

translation.en: And I-- I'm into that.
And when you see that hill-- I mean, if you're the type of person who likes
translation.ko: 그 언덕을 보면... 그러니까 그런 걸 좋아하는 사람이라면

translation.en: that kinda thing, you can't not want to run down it.
translation.ko: 언덕을 뛰어 내려가지 않곤 못 배길 거예요

translation.en: [narrator] Wrapping the cheese is considered a great honor...
There we go. Yeah.
...bestowed upon the elders of Brockworth,
before they watch the village youth plummet to almost certain agony.
-Hold this side. -[woman] This is Flo.
-I'll roll it. -Flo won the race last year.
translation.ko: - 제가 돌릴게요 - 작년에 여자 부문에서 우승했죠

translation.en: -Did you? -Yeah!
-She's gonna do it again this year. -God bless you. Good luck.
Thank you very much. I think I'll need it.
[Florence] I'm a little bit competitive.
Quite like a race. Just a little bit.
translation.ko: 그런 경주를 할 때는요 살짝 그래요

translation.en: If someone starts sprinting, I'm going to try and join in. [laughs]
translation.ko: 누가 달리기 시작하면 저도 같이 달려야 하죠

translation.en: That looks like a proper cheese-rolling cheese.
And you have to hold it above your head.
[Florence] Well, I never saw anything that any of the boys could do
as being something that I couldn't do, too.
translation.ko: 난 여자니까 못 한다고 생각해 본 적이 없어요

translation.en: So, I grew up believing I couldn't get hurt.
translation.ko: 어릴 땐 제가 무쇠 인간인 줄 알았어요

translation.en: Everyone who came to school with a cast on,
translation.ko: 가끔 보면 애들이 깁스를 하고 학교에 오는데

translation.en: I thought that was the coolest thing that anyone had.
translation.ko: 그게 그렇게 멋있어 보일 수가 없었어요

translation.en: And I really wanted one, so I used to always go and jump higher,
translation.ko: 저도 하고 싶었죠 그래서 더 높은 데서 뛰어내리고

translation.en: stumble down things faster.
Whatever anyone else did, I wanted to go a bit further.
In my mind, I thought, if I broke something,
then I finally get my cast.
It never happened.
[narrator] In her quest for a cast,
Florence Early has run Cooper's Hill on three occasions...
translation.ko: 플로렌스 얼리는 쿠퍼스 힐을 세 차례 내달렸다

translation.en: stretching over a decade.
She has never lost.
[woman] Oh, my God!
[Florence] I first ran it when I was 17 in 2008.
My brother, he came second, and I had--
I had that to beat.
And the second time, I had been at a party.
We hadn't slept yet. We'd been up all night.
All the women were all lined up, preparing.
I just jumped over at the very last seconds.
That was not thought through at all, but it was-- it worked out.
translation.ko: 생각하고 한 행동은 아닌데 효과가 있었어요

translation.en: I love it. I really love it. It's fun.
[interviewer] You're not afraid?
[laughing] No, not really. I'm too short to be afraid. And too young. [laughs]
Last year, I was in the middle of a year of sobriety,
but it turned out, being sober did not help me.
The feeling would be like if somebody took you from the waist
and dump tackled you down.
And then did it again.
And then again before you've caught your breath.
translation.ko: 또 하는 거죠 숨이 턱하고 막힐 때까지요

translation.en: And it's that feeling.
Your whole body's off the ground and you're coming down.
translation.ko: 온몸이 붕 떴다가 떨어질 때 나는 느낌

translation.en: That's a normal shoulder. It's smooth.
And this... this is the...
the bone that's... yeah.
I thought my shoulder was just dislocated,
and I thought they'd shove it back in.
It turned out it wasn't my shoulder,
it was my collarbone.
The reality of that is that they-- It can't be fixed. And it's still--
It's still dislocated. And it will be for the rest of my life.
translation.ko: 아직도 탈골돼 있어요 평생 이렇게 살아야 한대요

translation.en: I've definitely developed an awareness of the fact that I am destructible
translation.ko: 이번 일을 계기로 저도 다칠 수 있다는 걸

translation.en: and I can get hurt.
And, I don't want that anymore.
I've gotta be more careful.
[Sara] I'm hoping Flo is slightly more flexible
when she goes down there this year.
I don't really want her to have to...
go through what she went through last year. Because she did tumble.
And very quick.
However, when I saw-- [chuckles]
When I seen her runnin' down it, she made me proud to be a woman.
translation.ko: 그래도 작년에 플로렌스를 보며 같은 여자인 게 자랑스러웠어요

translation.en: [narrator] No woman has ever won the race more than three times.
translation.ko: 지금껏 세 번 이상 우승한 여성 참가자는 없다

translation.en: If Flo wins this year,
she will become the most successful female cheese-chaser in history.
translation.ko: 역사상 가장 성공한 여성 치즈 추격자가 된다

translation.en: But if she wants to make it down in one piece,
she's going to have to call on a higher power.
Somewhere out there,
a shadowy figure looms over the hill that made him.
translation.ko: 그를 유명하게 만든 언덕 위로 그림자 형체가 어렴풋이 보인다

translation.en: More myth than man.
More man than manchego.
This champion of champions is the only one who can answer that call.
translation.ko: 이 챔피언 중의 챔피언만이 언덕의 부름에 응할 수 있다

translation.en: [Sara] Usain Bolt is known for being
the fastest human to run the 100 meters.
translation.ko: 100m를 가장 빨리 달리는 사람이 우사인 볼트라고 하죠

translation.en: Not quite.
Chris Anderson ran--
I think it's slightly over 100 meters.
And I think it's 8.2, his record is.
I think you'll find that's faster than Bolt's 100 meters.
[narrator] Christopher Anderson is a former soldier
and a Brockworth legend.
He holds the men's world record
translation.ko: 남자 부문 세계 기록 보유자인 그는

translation.en: and is the undisputed king of Cooper's Hill.
[Florence] He's a legend. And he's a machine.
The way he falls and then pops back up. It's amazing.
Chris is exactly what I need.
I will take any-- any advice he has for me.
[Chris] There she is.
If I was you, I'd be starting here. Straight for the gate.
Right. Yeah.
These channels, where the rain's going, you wanna avoid it.
-Yeah. Use these steps, aren't they? -Just use these.
[Chris] So...
You'll probably fall around here.
-Yeah. -Because-- See?
-[laughing] There you go. -There. Right on cue.
If you win that race, on the day, you're the king of the hill.
translation.ko: 그날 경주에서 이기면 넌 언덕의 왕이 돼

translation.en: [John] The first time, Christopher had come second...
and ever since, he's won it.
He's got his own technique, and he just knows every line on the hill.
translation.ko: 자기만의 기술도 있지만 언덕을 속속들이 알죠

translation.en: When you're coming down, if you do fall...
kinda like-- When you fall, just...
you roll into it.
Then, once you've rolled, once you go over your butt...
-Yeah. Spring. -...spring onto your feet.
[narrator] There is only one women's race each year,
translation.ko: 이 경주는 여자 부문은 1년에 단 한 차례지만

translation.en: but there are three men's races,
because, as all Brockites know,
men are three times stupider than women.
[Florence] I don't want to do it.
[Chris] Just... pick a spot.
[narrator] Each year, Chris runs every race, winning a world record of 22 cheeses...
translation.ko: 크리스는 매년 모든 경주에 참가해 치즈 22개란 세계 기록을 수립한다

translation.en: ...which is a ridiculous number of cheeses.
The women's world record? -[yells indistinctly] -Three.
[John] Christopher wins it three times in the year.
But with ladies, you get one race a year.
translation.ko: 근데 여자 부문은 1년에 한 번 열리거든요

translation.en: For a lady to win more than three races, it would be astronomical.
translation.ko: 그러니까 여자가 세 번 이상 우승한다는 건 엄청난 거죠

translation.en: Flo Early's got three at the moment, and she's entering again this year.
translation.ko: 플로 얼리가 세 번 우승했고 올해 다시 출전합니다

translation.en: And if she gets the fourth win, she'll have the title as king of the hill
translation.ko: 4번째 우승을 거둔다면 언덕의 왕이 될 거예요

translation.en: -for ladies, queen of the hill. -[giggling]
-Yeah. That's 'cause you-- -That one-- The second one hurt.
translation.ko: - 그래, 이건 왜 그런 거냐면... - 두 번째 굴렀을 때 아팠어

translation.en: It feels like the achievement will be not hurting myself.
translation.ko: 이번 대회 목표는 다치지 않는 거예요

translation.en: If I can get down without breaking something,
then I'll be happy.
-[Chris] Maybe. -I might need a break for my shoulder.
-[Chris] Don't wanna hurt yourself before. -Things are hurting.
translation.ko: 그래, 경주 앞두고 다치면 안 돼 움직이면 아파

translation.en: [narrator] But Chris won't be running this year.
The universe, and his wife,
have other plans for him.
[John] For Christopher to have won the world record last year,
translation.ko: 크리스토퍼가 작년에 세계 신기록을 세우고 나서

translation.en: it was like,
"I've done what I wanted."
And then his wife said, "Well, we've booked a holiday
for next year, because, as a family, we've never been away."
translation.ko: 가족끼리 여행 간 적이 한번도 없다면서요

translation.en: They booked it up, Chris paid the deposit,
and then realized it was on the weekend of the cheese roll.
translation.ko: 내고 보니 치즈 롤이 열리는 주말이더래요

translation.en: [Chris] I was tricked.
-Tricked... -[Chris] Tricked into it.
We got offered a holiday. -I didn't know the dates. -[laughing]
I reckon, hundred percent, that Sophie knew
right from the word "go" what she was doing.
I think he's gutted. He'd rather be here running.
translation.ko: 크리스가 실망이 크죠 휴가보다 경주가 더 좋대요

translation.en: [narrator] With Chris not competing,
the weight of the Anderson family tradition
has fallen on different shoulders.
[girl] They were making a big deal about Chris not doing it,
translation.ko: 삼촌이 경주에 못 나간다니 난리가 난 거예요

translation.en: and I was there, like,
"Chris isn't doing it, but I'm still here to represent that name."
translation.ko: 저도 앤더슨 가문을 대표해 출전하는데 말이에요

translation.en: [narrator] Kacie Anderson is 17... and is Chris's niece.
And while this is her first year chasing the cheese,
Kacie is no stranger to Cooper's Hill.
[Kacie] There's three uphill races. I've run it four times and won three.
translation.ko: 오르막 경주가 있는데 네 번 출전해 세 번 우승했어요

translation.en: I think she's got the record for the amount of uphill races won.
So, for her to go on to the downhill race now,
I've got nothing but admiration for her.
[Kacie] When you get to that bit--
-Which bit? -At the path.
-[John] Yeah. -[Chris] Yes?
[Kacie] What do you want me doing? Am I coming off of it, or--?
Stay to the-- This side of the path.
Looking down at the hill when I was running it, I was like,
"I could never run down this, at all."
[Kacie] Watching the footage back from last year, I was watching Flo,
translation.ko: 작년 경주 영상을 봤어요 플로를 봤는데

translation.en: and she was literally just flying and bouncing.
And then I looked around, and everyone else was bum-shuffling.
I assure you, that's not gonna be me.
Flo was 17 when she first won.
It's almost an inspiration and, like, a boost to do something.
translation.ko: 저한테 동기 부여가 되죠 잘해야겠단 생각이 들어요

translation.en: I'd go out there for the fun and for the enjoyment,
but I'd also go out there to try my best and see if I can win.
translation.ko: 최선을 다해 우승에 도전해 보고 싶어요

translation.en: And, as silly as that sounds,
if Chris can do it, I don't see why I can't.
translation.ko: 크리스 삼촌이 했는데 저라고 못 하겠어요?

translation.en: [narrator] Where does this fine tradition come from?
translation.ko: 이런 훌륭한 전통은 어디서 오는 것일까?

translation.en: The origins of the cheese roll are known only through oral history.
translation.ko: 치즈 롤의 기원은 구전으로만 전해 내려온다

translation.en: A story passed lovingly from generation to generation.
My name's Jem Wakeman.
I'm master of ceremonies of the Gloucestershire cheese roll.
translation.ko: 제 이름은 젬 웨이크먼입니다 글로스터셔 치즈 롤 대회 사회자죠

translation.en: One of those things, you can't find a great deal about it.
I heard that there was evidence of something talking about it in 1826.
Some say 1700s, some say 16.
Two to 300 years old.
Centuries.
Thousands of years. Thousands of years.
[laughing] There's all sorts of stories.
So, from what I've read,
it was an old pagan ritual,
and they used to chuck a cheese down the hill
to bring good luck to the harvest.
[Sara] There is word that it's in the Doomsday Book,
relating to a cheese... and a hill.
However, we've never seen that.
The tradition of it, I'm not one hundred percent.
It's something to do with coopers, were barrel-makers.
[Jem] They'd roll barrels down the hill,
and the barrel that stayed together the longest,
translation.ko: 가장 오래 견딘 통을 만든 사람을

translation.en: he was the best barrel-maker.
It was called "Cooper's Hill." Coopers make barrels,
so it's gotta come from that.
I don't know why-- How it ever got changed to a cheese.
I-- I don't know. I don't know.
Make up the story you want.
It's... disappeared into oblivion, but it's something which has happened.
translation.ko: 망각 속으로 사라졌지만 기원이 있는 건 확실해요

translation.en: [narrator] The people of Brockworth are not historians.
True Brockites live in the moment.
And they will risk death
to keep their tradition alive.
You know I won't go and watch you.
I can't stand on the side.
You could at the bottom. They have an area for picnics
where families and babies come.
[mother] And how do you feel about her cheese-rolling?
translation.ko: 얘가 치즈 롤링하는 거 어떻게 생각해?

translation.en: Glad I haven't known that she was going to do any of the ones she's done.
translation.ko: 경주 전에 내가 몰랐다는 게 감사할 따름이야

translation.en: We can't stop her. But we couldn't when she was 16 either.
translation.ko: 우린 얘 못 말려 16살 때도 못 말렸잖아

translation.en: Then, we didn't know she was going to try on that occasion.
translation.ko: 물론 그땐 경주에 참가하는 것조차 몰랐지만

translation.en: You just came home with a cheese and your knickers full of mud.
translation.ko: 속옷에 진흙을 잔뜩 묻힌 채 치즈를 들고 집에 왔지

translation.en: Unfortunately, I do know about this one and I feel uncomfortable about it.
translation.ko: 이번 경주는 미리 알게 돼 마음이 불편해

translation.en: In what way?
-Well, I'm worried about her. -Why?
Well, because it's--
-It's so dangerous. -[mother] Yeah.
Last year, you broke your shoulder. I think, you've been lucky.
[Florence] I need to let go of the world I remember.
Because I can remember every single--
you know, every single time I got winded.
Any sort of trauma,
when you repeat that, when you go back there,
it kind of comes up.
This year, going back to that hill got my heart racing,
translation.ko: 올 한 해 언덕에 갈 때마다 심장이 쿵쾅댔죠

translation.en: and I'm definitely, sort of...
getting the muscle memory. "Actually, this hill scares me."
Well, I just need to...
face it. Like it's the first time again.
translation.ko: 직면하는 수밖에 없어요 처음 출전하는 사람처럼

translation.en: [Kacie] It's the top bit I'm scared for. I haven't practiced it.
translation.ko: 언덕 위쪽을 연습 안 해서 걱정이야

translation.en: -Makes me sick looking up it. -I know.
People don't realize how stupid it is until you get there.
translation.ko: 다들 올라가서야 멍청한 짓인 걸 깨닫는다니까

translation.en: [man] We haven't had a lot of rain, so the ground is solid. Therefore,
translation.ko: 비가 많이 안 와서 땅이 단단해요

translation.en: that cheese is gonna-- It will probably hit its top speed today.
I could never have the balls to do what you're doing.
translation.ko: 난 용기가 없어서 참가 못 해

translation.en: Fair play to you.
[Kacie] I'm surprised I do. Not gonna lie.
-[man] It's gonna be a fast race? -[man 2] A fast one.
Oh. Jesus Christ.
Japanese!
-[Kacie] I'm so scared! -[Florence] Oh, you're gonna be fine!
[man] We're a rugby team. We, um--
-[man 2] My goodness. -It's just catching people
as they run down so they don't hit the fence.
-And then-- -[interviewer] Fast or...? It goes fast?
Oh, they're very fast.
But not very fast after we get to them.
-I'm so fucking... - Assuming I'll break my sternum.
translation.ko: 나 완전히... - 가슴이 터질 것 같아 - 추운 게 아냐, 무서워서 그래!

translation.en: I'm not cold, just scared!
translation.ko: - 가슴이 터질 것 같아 - 추운 게 아냐, 무서워서 그래!

translation.en: -[girl 2] You're nervous! -Yes!
-[Kacie] I don't even like cheese. -[girl] You don't.
[Kacie] I don't!
What time is it? How long--? Have you--?
Five minutes to first race.
-[Flo] Should we find a spot? -[Kacie] Let's go.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, we are moments away from the first men's race!
translation.ko: 여러분, 잠시 후 남자 부문 경주가 시작됩니다!

translation.en: [crowd chanting rapidly] Cheese! Cheese! Cheese! Cheese! Cheese! Cheese! Cheese!
Spectators wonder what they'll see.
Are they gonna see a limb this way? A hand like that?
translation.ko: 발이 이렇게 된 거? 손이 이렇게 된 거?

translation.en: Are they gonna...? It's scary.
[Jem] Because it's dangerous. Every sport.
You can get smacked in the head by a cricket ball, can't you?
translation.ko: 크리켓 하다가 공에 맞아 머리가 깨지기도 하거든요

translation.en: If you've never jumped out of a plane with a parachute before,
translation.ko: 난생처음 낙하산을 메고 비행기에서 뛰어내리는 것과

translation.en: it'd be like that.
But you haven't got a parachute. You've got a steep hill.
translation.ko: 낙하산 대신 가파른 언덕이 있는 거죠

translation.en: And we get the broken legs...
mainly ankles.
Collarbones are high up on the breakage list.
translation.ko: 쇄골도 쉽게 부러지는 것 중 하나예요

translation.en: Concussion. That's-- that's a good one.
The worst injury I've actually ever seen in the nine years is an--
translation.ko: 9년 동안 제가 본 가장 심각한 부상은...

translation.en: Foot... the other way around.
[Jem] No one's ever broke a back, neck or nothing.
translation.ko: 허리나 목이 부러진 건 못 봤으니

translation.en: It ain't got that bad.
There's always a first time.
[paramedic] You all right?
-I feel okay. -That's lovely.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, the ladies' race is about to begin. The ladies' race.
translation.ko: 여러분, 이제 곧 여자 부문 경주가 시작됩니다

translation.en: Yeah! Come on!
[exhaling] I'm so scared.
[man] Get yourselves lined up.
Hey! Get yourselves lined up.
They're moving in first, and then cameras.
-Cameras can go. -[Jem] Best of luck.
Best of luck to you.
[Jem] Best of luck to you with this thing.
[man 2] Are you ready?!
[crowd] Yeah!
[announcer] Brace yourselves.
Good luck, ladies. Good luck.
One to be ready.
Two to be steady.
Three for the cheese!
Four to go!
[narrator] So much of life is about leaps into the unknown.
translation.ko: 인생은 위험을 감수할 때 의미가 있다고 한다

translation.en: Tradition is a road map from those who have leapt before.
translation.ko: 전통은 위험을 감수한 사람들이 주는 지도다

translation.en: But sometimes the road you need isn't on any map.
translation.ko: 하지만 가야 할 길이 지도에 없을 때가 있다

translation.en: Sometimes, you have to carve your own path.
[Sara] I fucking love you, Flo. Are you all right?
-Did I win? -[Sara] Yes!
[Florence] Yay!
[Sara] I'm so proud of you. What can I say?
-That was the last time. -[Sara] Scared?
-[Flo] Never again. -Look.
translation.ko: - 다시는 안 해요 - 사진 좀 봐

translation.en: [Sara] I fucking love that girl.
I would like to introduce you to our ladies champion, Flo.
[man 2] Good one, Flo.
[man 2] Are you ecstatic?
[narrator] For some people, tradition is a path to glory.
translation.ko: 어떤 이들에겐 전통이 영광으로 가는 길이지만

translation.en: For others, it's peer pressure from dead people.
[Kacie] All I can remember...
I was just talking to myself. I was like, "Oh, my God. I'm gonna die."
As soon as they said go--
-[John] Go on, Kacie! -[Kacie] I just ran.
Obviously, having Chris telling me what to do, it did help at the beginning.
translation.ko: 크리스 삼촌이 가르쳐 준 게 처음엔 도움 됐어요

translation.en: [man] Come on, Flo! Come on!
[Kacie] However, towards the middle, there was no stopping that.
translation.ko: 근데 중간쯤 가니까 통제가 안 되더군요

translation.en: Keeping going, Kacie!
Go on, Kace!
[Kacie] Everything flashed before my eyes. And I was just rolling.
translation.ko: 눈앞에서 모든 게 휙휙 지나갔어요 계속 구르기만 했죠

translation.en: I can't really remember much after rolling. [chuckling] That was about it.
translation.ko: 그 후의 일은 기억이 안 나요 그게 다예요

translation.en: I would definitely, hundred percent, do it again.
Flo has the title, but I'm gonna try and get it. And try and top it off.
translation.ko: 플로한테 1등은 뺏겼지만 열심히 해서 챔피언 될 거예요

translation.en: That's my aim.
[Florence] Yay! It's over!
-I was so close to you! -I saw you! I was like, "Oh, shit--!"
[Kacie] I was just rolling. I couldn't stop.
I know. I've never had so many people within my peripheral.
translation.ko: 알아, 오늘 보니까 잘하는 사람 정말 많더라

translation.en: [Kacie] How's your ankle?
[Florence] Don't know. They gave me an ice pack.
-It's not broken? -They set me up.
I assume it's not broken.
[narrator] Flo's foot was, indeed, broken.
And she finally got the cast she wanted.
-[Kacie] Are you gonna do it again? -[Flo] Not doing it again.
translation.ko: 다시 할 거야? - 또 할 거야? 아냐? - 아니, 다시는 안 해

translation.en: No, I'm done. I have every-- I have every faith -that you're gonna be taking the next-- -Aw.
translation.ko: 난 은퇴했어 네가 내 뒤를 이을 거라고 확신해

translation.en: -[all laughing] -[Kacie] I hope so--
[John] You've got the championship. Even if it gets broke,
translation.ko: 넌 세계 챔피언이야 설사 기록이 깨진들

translation.en: you'll go down in history.
[Kacie] An honor to participate in something that's a tradition.
translation.ko: 지금껏 전통으로 남아 있는 일에 참여해 영광이었어요

translation.en: When I'm older and I can't run it anymore,
translation.ko: 나이가 들어 더는 달릴 수 없게 되면

translation.en: I'll go there and watch,
and I'll be watching these teenage girls run down the hill.
translation.ko: 십 대 소녀들이 달려 내려가는 걸 보며

translation.en: You're just, like, "That was me when I was younger."
translation.ko: 추억에 젖을 거예요 '나도 젊을 때 저랬지'

translation.en: [Kacie] I don't like cheese.
[Kacie] It's all for you.
-[Kacie] It smells so bad. -[Florence] Mm-mm.
[Florence] This has been a really fun experience.
It wouldn't have happened if I had said "no."
-[Kacie] Disgusting. -[laughing]
Absolutely vile.
[Flo] Now I think I should just say "yes" to everything
and see what happens next.
[narrator] At the heart of every tradition,
there is a lesson.
Something that our ancestors wanted us to know.
Most seek to guide us away from the dangers of the world,
translation.ko: 대개는 세상 위험으로부터 우리를 안내하는 게 목표다

translation.en: for the world is a scary and unpredictable place.
translation.ko: 세상은 무섭고 예측할 수 없는 곳이니까

translation.en: But some serve a different purpose.
A deeper purpose.
Those traditions remind us that while we may be mortal...
translation.ko: 그런 전통은 우리가 아무리 유한한 존재인들

translation.en: we cannot live in fear.
translation.ko: 두려움 속에선 살 수 없단 걸 상기시킨다

translation.en: So, let us charge headlong down all the insane hills,
translation.ko: 그러니 우리가 잘못될 수 있다는 걸 알면서도

translation.en: knowing in our hearts that one of them will be our undoing.
But not this one.
And not today.
For, right now, we are alive.
And we are the champions.
